hedline.hl1: CARDINAL HEALTH UNIT TO BUY PART OF ADVANCED POLYMER

abstract.p: Drug wholesaler Cardinal Health buys rights to two skin medications from Advanced Polymer Systems Inc for $25 million (S)

block.p: The R. P. Scherer Corporation, a subsidiary of the drug wholesaler Cardinal Health Inc., said yesterday that it had agreed to buy the rights for two skin medication technologies from Advanced Polymer Systems Inc. for $25 million. Scherer, based in Basking Ridge, N.J., may pay up to an additional $26.5 million over the next three years depending on the profits of the acquired businesses. The purchase, which is expected to close in 90 days, includes the rights to Advanced Polymer's Microsponge and Polytrap technologies, sponge-like chemical compounds that are ingredients in gels, creams and powders. The deal also includes a plant in Lafayette, La., that produces the chemical compounds. Advanced Polymer is based in Redwood City, Calif.
